intro: Vernonanthura stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking star-shaped blossoms, which typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant belongs to the family Onagraceae and is known for its delicate appearance and short blooming period. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
